metadata.query: weird, bizarre, funny, quirky, and unusual news stories from India in the last week

articles.headline: Devotees Drink AC Water Thinking It’s Holy ‘Charan Amrit’ at Vrindavan Temple
articles.summary: At the Banke Bihari Temple in Vrindavan, devotees were seen drinking water dripping from an elephant-shaped spout, believing it to be sacred ‘Charan Amrit’. In reality, the water was merely AC discharge. Despite clarification, many continued to drink and splash it, turning the scene into a viral spectacle.
articles.detailed_summary:
• The incident took place at the Banke Bihari Temple in Vrindavan, Uttar Pradesh.
• Water was dripping from an elephant-shaped spout integrated into the temple’s architecture.
• Devotees cupped and drank the water, believing it to be holy ‘Charan Amrit’.
• It was later revealed that the water was actually air-conditioning discharge.
• Even after clarification, many devotees continued to consume and splash the water.
articles.why_it_matters: Because when life gives you AC drip, some folks will bless it anyway. It’s a quirky reminder that faith and plumbing can sometimes mix in the most unexpected ways.

articles.headline: Jhansi Auto Rickshaw Unleashes a Human Stream—19 Passengers Squeeze Out
articles.summary: A viral video from Jhansi, Uttar Pradesh, captured the moment when 19 people emerged one after another from a single auto-rickshaw during a police check. The sight left netizens in stitches, while police confirmed the driver was caught and action taken.
articles.detailed_summary:
• The video surfaced from Jhansi, Uttar Pradesh, during a routine police check.
• A single auto-rickshaw appeared to disgorge 19 passengers in succession.
• The scene resembled a bottomless vehicle, baffling onlookers.
• Social media users joked about the auto being a “school bus” in disguise.
• Jhansi Police confirmed the driver was apprehended and appropriate action was taken.
articles.why_it_matters: Because when your ride turns into a people conveyor belt, you know India’s jugaad spirit is alive and well. Who needs a bus when you’ve got an auto with infinite capacity?

articles.headline: Man Drinks IV Fluid Because He Couldn't Find Water in Bihar
articles.summary: In a bizarre viral clip from Bihar, a man was seen using IV fluid as a substitute for water when he couldn’t find any. The audacious act sparked a flurry of reactions online, with netizens both amused and alarmed by his unconventional hydration hack.
articles.detailed_summary:
• The video emerged from Bihar, where liquor is banned, adding to the oddity.
• The man claimed he couldn’t find water, so he resorted to IV fluid.
• He poured the medical solution into a glass and drank it.
• Social media users speculated about his access to IV fluid and potential medical consequences.
• Reactions ranged from marveling at his creativity to warning about the dangers of such a stunt.
articles.why_it_matters: Because when life gives you IV fluid, some folks will treat it like a fancy water bottle. It’s a hydration hack gone wildly off-script—and medically questionable.
